title: Prehistoric monsters (dNethack)
data:
**Prehistoric monsters** don't appear normally, but [fossils](/index.php?title=Fossil\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Fossil (page does not exist)") of them may be found buried in the walls, and they spawn in the [Caveman quest](/wiki/Caveman_quest "Caveman quest").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Trilobite](#Trilobite)
- [2 Saber-toothed cat](#Saber-toothed_cat)
- [3 Triceratops](#Triceratops)
- [4 Tyrannosaurus](#Tyrannosaurus)
- [5 Diplodocus](#Diplodocus)

## Trilobite

| a trilobite *(No tile)*                                         |                   |
| --------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------------- |
| **[Difficulty](/wiki/Monster_difficulty "Monster difficulty")** | 4                 |
| **Attacks**                                                     | Bite 1d4 physical |
|                                                                 |                   |

| a trilobite *(No tile)*                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |                                 |
| --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------- |
| **[Difficulty](/wiki/Monster_difficulty "Monster difficulty")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 | 4                               |
| **Attacks**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     | Bite 1d4 physical               |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |                                 |
| **Base [level](/wiki/Monster_level "Monster level")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           | 3                               |
| **Base [experience](/wiki/Experience_points "Experience points")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              | 40                              |
| **[Speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                | 12                              |

|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |                                 |
| **[Frequency](/wiki/Monster_frequency "Monster frequency")** (by [normal means](/wiki/Normal_mechanism "Normal mechanism"))                                                                                                                                                                                     | 0 (Not randomly generated)      |
| **[Genocidable](/wiki/Genocide "Genocide")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    | No                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |                                 |
| **[Weight](/wiki/Weight "Weight")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             | 140                             |
| **[Nutritional value](/wiki/Nutrition "Nutrition")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            | 100                             |
| **[Size](/wiki/Physical_size "Physical size")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 | tiny                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |                                 |
| **[Resistances](/wiki/Resistance "Resistance")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                | [poison](/wiki/Poison "Poison") |
| **Resistances [conveyed](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               | [poison](/wiki/Poison "Poison") |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |                                 |
| A trilobite:* has no hands.
* has no head.
* is an [animal](/wiki/Animal "Animal").
* can [lay eggs](/wiki/Oviparous "Oviparous").
* is [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivore "Carnivore").
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* cannot be [tamed](/wiki/Scroll_of_taming "Scroll of taming"). |                                 |

**Trilobites** are the most common form of fossil.

* cannot be [tamed](/wiki/Scroll_of_taming "Scroll of taming"). |                                                         |

| A triceratops:* has no hands.
* is an [animal](/wiki/Animal "Animal").
* has a [thick hide](/wiki/Thick-skinned "Thick-skinned").
* can [lay eggs](/wiki/Oviparous "Oviparous").
* is [herbivorous](/wiki/Herbivore "Herbivore").
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* is [nasty](/wiki/M2_NASTY "M2 NASTY").
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").
* normally appears in small [groups](/wiki/Group "Group").
* cannot be [tamed](/wiki/Scroll_of_taming "Scroll of taming"). |                                                                                 |

| A tyrannosaurus:* has no hands.
* is an [animal](/wiki/Animal "Animal").
* has a [thick hide](/wiki/Thick-skinned "Thick-skinned").
* can [lay eggs](/wiki/Oviparous "Oviparous").
* is [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivore "Carnivore").
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* can [follow](/wiki/Follower "Follower") you to other levels.
* is [nasty](/wiki/M2_NASTY "M2 NASTY").
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").
* cannot be [tamed](/wiki/Scroll_of_taming "Scroll of taming"). |                                                                                 |

Great care must be taken around the **tyrannosauruses** encountered in the Caveman quest. They are as fast as an unhasted PC, and their bite is very dangerous.

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
Prehistoric monsters (dNethack)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

Prehistoric monsters don't appear normally, but fossils of them may be found buried in the walls, and they spawn in the Caveman quest.

Contents

  • 1 Trilobite
  • 2 Saber-toothed cat
  • 3 Triceratops
  • 4 Tyrannosaurus
  • 5 Diplodocus

Trilobite

a trilobite (No tile)
Difficulty 4
Attacks Bite 1d4 physical
a trilobite (No tile)
Difficulty 4
Attacks

Bite 1d4 physical

Base level 3
Base experience 40
Speed 12
Base AC 3
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 140
Nutritional value 100
Size tiny
Resistances poison
Resistances conveyed poison

A trilobite:

  • has no hands.
  • has no head.
  • is an animal.
  • can lay eggs.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • cannot be tamed.

Trilobites are the most common form of fossil.

Saber-toothed cat

f saber-toothed cat (No tile)
Difficulty 12
Attacks Claw 2d4 physical, Claw 2d4 physical, Bite 2d8 physical
f saber-toothed cat (No tile)
Difficulty 12
Attacks

Claw 2d4 physical, Claw 2d4 physical, Bite 2d8 physical

Base level 10
Base experience 251
Speed 12
Base AC 6
Base MR 0
Alignment -5 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 2250
Nutritional value 800
Size large
Resistances cold
Resistances conveyed cold

A saber-toothed cat:

  • has no hands.
  • is an animal.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • is strong.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • cannot be tamed.

Triceratops

D triceratops (No tile)
Difficulty 18
Attacks Butt 3d6 physical, Butt 3d8 physical, Butt 3d8 physical
D triceratops (No tile)
Difficulty 18
Attacks

Butt 3d6 physical, Butt 3d8 physical, Butt 3d8 physical

Base level 15
Base experience 561
Speed 10
Base AC 4
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 4500
Nutritional value 1000
Size huge
Resistances poison, level drain
Resistances conveyed acid

A triceratops:

  • has no hands.
  • is an animal.
  • has a thick hide.
  • can lay eggs.
  • is herbivorous.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • is nasty.
  • is strong.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • normally appears in small groups.
  • cannot be tamed.

Tyrannosaurus

D tyrannosaurus (No tile)
Difficulty 19
Attacks Bite 7d6 physical
D tyrannosaurus (No tile)
Difficulty 19
Attacks

Bite 7d6 physical

Base level 18
Base experience 699
Speed 12
Base AC 4
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 4500
Nutritional value 1000
Size huge
Resistances poison, level drain
Resistances conveyed acid

A tyrannosaurus:

  • has no hands.
  • is an animal.
  • has a thick hide.
  • can lay eggs.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can follow you to other levels.
  • is nasty.
  • is strong.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • cannot be tamed.

Great care must be taken around the tyrannosauruses encountered in the Caveman quest. They are as fast as an unhasted PC, and their bite is very dangerous.

Diplodocus

D diplodocus  
Difficulty 22
Attacks Claw 8d12 physical
D diplodocus  
Difficulty 22
Attacks

Claw 8d12 physical

Base level 20
Base experience 811
Speed 10
Base AC 6
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 9000
Nutritional value 1500
Size gigantic
Resistances poison, level drain
Resistances conveyed acid

A diplodocus:

  • can survive underwater.
  • has no hands.
  • is an animal.
  • has a thick hide.
  • can lay eggs.
  • is herbivorous.
  • is nasty.
  • is strong.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • normally appears in small groups.
  • cannot be tamed.

Great care must be taken around the diplodocuses encountered in the Caveman quest. They are slower than average, but their tail slam is incredibly damaging.

rawPage:
'''Prehistoric monsters''' don't appear normally, but [[fossil]]s of them may be found buried in the walls, and they spawn in the [[Caveman quest]].

== Trilobite ==

{{monster
 |name=trilobite
 |symbol={{gray|a}}
 |tile=
 |difficulty=4
 |level=3
 |experience=40
 |speed=12
 |AC=3
 |MR=0
 |align=0
 |frequency=0
 |genocidable=No
 |attacks=Bite 1d4 physical
 |weight=140
 |nutr=100
